sentences.en: Ada and I agreed that this Caprice about the wind was a fiction.
sentences.cn: 婀达和我都认为这个对风向的反复无常的说法全是假话.

sentences.en: Don't act on caprice. Study your problem.
sentences.cn: 不要任性行事, 研究一下自己的问题.

sentences.en: He acted not from reason, but from caprice.
sentences.cn: 他不是凭理智, 而是凭幻想来行动.
他对每一种异想天开感到满意.

sentences.en: Her decision to wear only black clothes was pure caprice.
sentences.cn: 她决定只穿黑衣服完全是忽发奇想.

sentences.en: Her refusal to go to the party is a mere caprice.
sentences.cn: 她拒绝参加宴会完全是无理由的突发之举.

sentences.en: His lack of money was the result of caprice in spending on unnecessary things.
sentences.cn: 他缺钱的原因是随意的买一些并不需要的东西.

sentences.en: I have suffered a martyrdom from their incompetency and caprice.
sentences.cn: 他们的无能和任性折磨得我够受了.

sentences.en: Mr Bennet was so odd a mixture of quick parts, sarcastic humour , reserve, and caprice.
sentences.cn: 班纳特先生是个古怪人,他一方面喜欢插科打诨, 爱挖苦人,同时又不苟言笑, 变幻莫测.

sentences.en: the caprices of a spoilt child
sentences.cn: 一个被宠坏的孩子的任性行为

sentences.en: To execute any caprice or order of her patients is her chiefest joy and reward.
sentences.cn: 执行病人的任何离奇想法或命令,是她的最重要的欢乐和酬劳.

sentences.en: We should solve the corresponding plan in caprice and seeking change innovatively.
sentences.cn: 求变善变、用创新解决应对方案.

sentences.en: With a sudden caprice of the wind, the boat was turned over.
sentences.cn: 船因风向突然改变而倾覆.

trans.tran_cn: 反复无常，任性的想法，随想曲，充满幻想力的作品
trans.tran_en: a sudden and unreasonable change of mind or behaviour
